odase.concurrency

Class AbstractTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • odase.concurrency.AbstractTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<AbstractTask>, WaitObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CallableTask, RunnableTask, WaitObjectSet

    public abstract class AbstractTask
extends Object
implements WaitObject, Comparable<AbstractTask>
    An abstract task for ODASE. An abstract task implements basic features such as knowing when the task has been started, and when it ends or if it has aborted (with an exception). It also implements the WaitObject interface, allowing other tasks to block on its completion.

      • addDependency

        public void addDependency(AbstractTask task)
        Register a dependency with this task.

      • addDependency

        public void addDependency(OdaseFuture f)
        Add a dependency. Add the dependency represented by the OdaseFuture

      • addDependency

        public void addDependency(WaitObject o)
        Add a dependency. Add the dependency represented by the WaitObject

      • addSubTask

        public void addSubTask(AbstractTask task)
        Add a subtask to this task. The task will not be marked as 'finished' until all its subtasks are also finished. A subtask does not behave like a dependency, it can be added during the task's execution and the task may begin before its subtasks begin.

      • addSubTask

        public void addSubTask(WaitObject o)
        Add a sub task. Add the subtask represented by the WaitObject.

      • addTaskListener

        public void addTaskListener(TaskListener listener)
        Add a new task listener to this task.

      • canComplete

        public boolean canComplete()
        True if this task can run to completion (to the point where it can free it's thread).

      • canStart

        public boolean canStart()
        True if ready to start (all dependencies have started)

        public int compareTo(AbstractTask task)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<AbstractTask>

      • getSerial

        public long getSerial()
        Get the task's serial number. -1 if there is no current meaningful serial number.

      • isAborted

        public boolean isAborted()
        True if the task has aborted.

      • isCompleted

        public boolean isCompleted()
        The task is completed. This means that the main work done by the task is done, and the task has freed it's thread, but sub tasks may still be unfinished.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        True if the task has finnished. This is true if isCompleted() is true and all subtasks have finished.

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        True if the task has started.

      • run

        public abstract void run()
                  throws InterruptedException,
                         ExecutionException
        Subclasses must override this method. Remembering to call begin() and() and abort() from it.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        ExecutionException

      • runTask

        public final void runTask()
        Run the task's run method and handle beginning and ending the task. This method may only be called from OdaseExecutor.
